Luna's Shawl $6.00 • Buy now!

Sometimes I’m not really sure how pattern ideas find their way into my head. They just kind of show up there with no explanation for their presence. This happened with Traveling Woman and Saroyan, and it has happened once again. I am pleased to present Luna’s Shawl.

Luna’s Shawl is knit with one full skein of sport weight yarn (335 yards, with inches to spare) and is comprised of cables and simple eyelet lace. It’s a bit of a quirky shape: rounded, not triangular, with a smaller wingspan and an emphasis on the shawl’s depth. It wears well with a shawl pin held off to the side.

Named after one of my favorite characters from Harry Potter, Lunaâ€™s Shawl is something I could see the ever perky Luna Lovegood wearing with her adorably mismatched outfits.

Luna is plucky, eccentric, adorable, and completely hilarious. The unique size and shape of the shawl remind me of something that Luna would wear, and the color (aptly named Luna Granite) is perfect for her unconventional wardrobe, but still pairs wear with a t-shirt and jeans.

The pattern includes row-by-row stitch counts for all rows of the shawl (increases, cable/stockinette, and cable/lace), charted cables and charted lace, with written instructions for both, and instructions for fingering and sport weight.

Luna’s Shawl is a quick and easy knit, with a moderate level of difficulty. The cable and lace charts are easily memorized 8 row repeats with very few special stitches worked on the wrong side rows.

Size, Gauge, and Yarn information

Fingering

Gauge: 20 sts and 28 rows per 4”/10cm, stockinette stitch
Needle: US 6 (4.0mm)
Finished size: 16”/40.5cm deep, 45”/114cm wingspan
Yarn: Approximately 425 yards fingering weight.
Yarn shown: Little Red Bicycle Hipster Sock (100% superwash merino, approximately 430 yards per 115 grams).

Sport

Gauge: 18 sts and 28 rows per 4”/10cm, stockinette stitch
Needle: US 6 (4.0mm)
Finished size: 15.5”/39cm deep, 38”/96.5cm wingspan
Yarn: Approximately 335 yards sport weight.
Yarn shown: Miss Babs Yummy Sport (100% superwash merino, 335 yards per 150grams).

Errata

Version 3: There is a series of typos in the second table, it shows even numbers starting at 50 when it should be showing odd numbers starting at 49. This error has been corrected in version 4.

Pattern Information

Gauge
20 stitches and 28 rows = 4 inches in fingering weight, stockinette (varies, see description for desired yarn weight)
Yardage
335 - 430 yards Fingering / 4 ply (14 wpi)
Yarns
Miss Babs Yummy Superwash Sport - 3 Ply (Sport) Little Red Bicycle Hipster sock (Fingering)
Needles
US 6 - 4.0 mm
Sizes
Fingering - 16"/40.5cm deep, 45"/114cm wingspan; Sport - 15.5"/39cm deep, 38"/96.5cm wingspan

$6.00 • Buy Luna's Shawl now!

About pattern purchases

Patterns are sold as downloadable PDF files through Ravelry, with payments processed by PayPal. You do not need an account to use either service.

If you have a Ravelry account, I suggest logging in prior to purchasing so that patterns are added to your library.

Get pattern help

Pattern support is provided free of charge for all of my patterns. We respond as quickly as possible, but sometimes it can take a day or two.

Submit a new help request through Zendesk.

You can also use Zendesk to report errors and ask non-technical questions.

Alternatively, you can try the Ravelry group.

Support is only provided via Zendesk.

FAQ

Can I teach a class using your knitting pattern?

Teaching licensing is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

Can I sell items made using your knitting patterns for profit or charity?

Not at this time.

How do I order wholesale copies for my LYS?

Pattern wholesaling is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

I found an error, how do I report it?

Oh newts! Submit your error through Zendesk and we will fix it.

Happy knitting!
